sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
England's royal stone at the head of the corner, through the wonderful working of almighty God. Set forth in a sermon preached in the Cathedral church at Gloucester, the 28th day of June, being a day of publick and solemn thanksgiving for His Majesties happy restauration. By Joh. Nelme, M.A. and Pastor of S. Michaels in the said city. Nelme, John, b. 1618 or 19.
[4], 24 p.
printed by Ja. Cottrel, for Henry Fletcher, at the sign of the three Gilt Cups in S. Pauls Church-yard, London : 1660.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "July 19". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

printed by Ja. Cottrel, for Henry Fletcher, at the sign of the three Gilt Cups in S. Pauls Church-yard, London : 1660.
